page.title: 07Public Houses, Herts.
page.content: We went out and made a count of all the pubs in 4 square kilometres. We found 8 altogether. The manager of the 'Mops and Brooms' at Well End became very interested in what we were doing and said that if we went the next day he would talk to us. We went and he gave us drinks and crisps. He told us that the pub was first known as 'The Lord Nelson' until it moved to a new site in 1915. The original 'Lord Nelson' was housed in the white cottage next door. The name 'Mops and Brooms' came from a competition to name the pub. The winning story told of a batle between gypsies using mops and factory workers using brooms as weapons. A lot of people think the story is true but it isn't.
